snippet: How can mosquitoes fly through a downpour and come out alive? A new study reports that the answer lies in the mosquito’s low mass and its strong exoskeleton.
abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that low mass and strong exoskeletons allow mosquitoes to navigate rainstorms, despite being struck by droplets 50 times their weight.
lead_paragraph: How can mosquitoes fly through a downpour and come out alive? A new study reports that the answer lies in the mosquito’s low mass and its strong exoskeleton.

headline.print_headline: For Mosquitoes, Rain Isn’t a Flight Hazard
headline.main: For Mosquitoes, Rain Isn’t a Flight Hazard

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
